question.text: Death while sleeping in closed room with burning coal furnace is due to

solution.text: Coal is a fossil fuel which on burning produces heat and gives out carbon monoxide as waste or pollutant. Haemoglobin shows more affinity to  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>  than oxygen. When this  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>  filled air is inhaled, it replaces oxygen in our blood and forms carboxyhemoglobin  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> .  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></math>  is very toxic and can lead to respiratory diseases and even cause neurological complications. Carbon monoxide poisoning can lead to death of the individual.
